instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message: Hello, I have A2289 when i restore i get error 4010, and when i try to revive i get error 75, the board was working before restore. But i changed the housing.

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message:
Connect charger cable before DFU cable.
Be sure machine continues to take current from charger, once DFU cable is connected.

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101648, member: 682"]
Connect charger cable before DFU cable.
Be sure machine continues to take current from charger, once DFU cable is connected.
[/QUOTE]
I did, it consume 19v and 0.052A, and it continue when the dfu cable
Is connected

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message:
AC2 shows it in DFU, or Recovery?

Check for knocked off components, broken trace, or damaged connectors.
What was the problem after changed in other housing?

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message:
DFU mode and when i try to revive it enters Recovery then i force it to DFU another time.
There was no problem till i tried to restore, then it did this error before the restore, i turned on normally.

threads.title: A2289 Stuck in DFU mode
threads.message:
You may need to try more times; sometimes completes DFU after days of trying.
Also test another cable and host machine; with different macOS installed.

You can also try with empty SoC ROM.
Don't forget to make a backup first...
